source: Florida Next Generation Sunshine State Standards

standards.description: Represent quantities with numbers up to 20
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Represent quantities with numbers up to 20, verbally, in writing, and with manipulatives.

standards.description: Model multiplication and division including problems presented in context
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Model multiplication and division including problems presented in context: repeated addition, multiplicative comparison, array, how many combinations, measurement, and partitioning.

standards.description: Use and represent numbers through millions in various forms
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Use and represent numbers through millions in various forms including standard form, expanded form, and word form.

standards.description: Represent addition and subtraction of decimals and fractions with like and unlike denominators
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Represent addition and subtraction of decimals and fractions with like and unlike denominators using models, place value, or properties.

standards.description: Construct and analyze tables, graphs, and equations to describe linear functions
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Construct and analyze tables, graphs, and equations to describe linear functions and other simple relations using both common language and algebraic notation.

standards.description: Use and justify the rules for adding, subtracting, multiplying, dividing, and finding the absolute value of integers
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Use and justify the rules for adding, subtracting, multiplying, dividing, and finding the absolute value of integers.

standards.description: Create and interpret tables, graphs, and models to represent, analyze, and solve problems related to linear equations
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Create and interpret tables, graphs, and models to represent, analyze, and solve problems related to linear equations, including analysis of domain, range, and the difference between discrete and continuous data.

standards.description: Solve linear equations in one variable that include simplifying algebraic expressions
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Solve linear equations in one variable that include simplifying algebraic expressions.

standards.description: Use knowledge of phonics to read unfamiliar words
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: The student uses knowledge of letter/sound relationships, structural analysis, and context clues to identify words.

standards.description: Determine the main idea or essential message in a text and identify relevant supporting details
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: Determine the main idea or essential message in grade-level or higher text through inferring, paraphrasing, summarizing, and identifying relevant details.

standards.description: Locate, explain, and use information from text features
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: The student will locate, explain, and use information from text features (e.g., table of contents, glossary, headings, charts, graphs, diagrams, illustrations).

standards.description: Use background knowledge of subject and related content areas, prereading strategies, graphic representations, and knowledge of text structure
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: The student uses background knowledge of subject and related content areas, prereading strategies, graphic representations, and knowledge of text structure to make and confirm complex predictions of content, purpose, and organization of a reading selection.

standards.description: Analyze the author's development of characters, setting, and plot
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: The student will analyze the way in which the author's development and use of characters, setting, and plot contribute to the theme.

standards.description: Analyze the development of the author's argument, perspective, or viewpoint in text
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: The student will analyze the development of the author's argument, perspective, or viewpoint in text.

standards.description: Distinguish human body parts and their basic functions
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Distinguish human body parts (brain, heart, lungs, stomach, muscles, and skeleton) and their basic functions.

standards.description: Identify the Sun as a star that emits energy
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Identify the Sun as a star that emits energy; some of it in the form of light.

standards.description: Measure and compare objects and materials based on their physical properties
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Measure and compare objects and materials based on their physical properties including: mass, shape, volume, color, hardness, texture, odor, taste, attraction to magnets.

standards.description: Compare and contrast the function of organs and other physical structures of plants and animals
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Compare and contrast the function of organs and other physical structures of plants and animals, including humans, for example: skin of animals vs. bark of trees.

standards.description: Describe and give examples of ways in which Earth's surface is built up and torn down by physical and chemical weathering, erosion, and deposition
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Describe and give examples of ways in which Earth's surface is built up and torn down by physical and chemical weathering, erosion, and deposition.

standards.description: Explore the scientific theory of evolution by recognizing and explaining ways in which genetic variation and environmental factors contribute to evolution by natural selection
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Explore the scientific theory of evolution by recognizing and explaining ways in which genetic variation and environmental factors contribute to evolution by natural selection and diversity of organisms.

standards.description: Recognize that there are a finite number of elements and that their atoms combine in a multitude of ways to produce compounds
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Recognize that there are a finite number of elements and that their atoms combine in a multitude of ways to produce compounds that make up all of the living and nonliving things that we encounter.

standards.description: Describe the scientific theory of cells (cell theory) and relate the history of its discovery
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Describe the scientific theory of cells (cell theory) and relate the history of its discovery to the advances in technology.

standards.description: Analyze primary and secondary sources
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Analyze primary and secondary sources.

standards.description: Identify physical features of Florida
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Identify physical features of Florida.

standards.description: Recognize the importance of economic activity in the United States
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Recognize the importance of making informed economic choices and identify incentives.

standards.description: Use timelines to identify chronological order of historical events
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Use timelines to identify chronological order of historical events.

standards.description: Recognize how Enlightenment ideas including Montesquieu's view of separation of powers and John Locke's theories related to natural law influenced the development of the United States Government
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Recognize how Enlightenment ideas including Montesquieu's view of separation of powers and John Locke's theories related to natural law and how they are related to the development of the United States Government.

standards.description: Provide supporting details for an answer from text, interview for oral history, or other sources
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Provide supporting details for an answer from text, interview for oral history, or other sources.

standards.description: Describe the importance of historiography, which includes how historical knowledge is obtained and transmitted
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Describe the importance of historiography, which includes how historical knowledge is obtained and transmitted, when interpreting events in history.
